definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: What's your take on this, dear reader?
sentences.chinese: 親愛的讀者有何高見呢？

sentences.english: Speak not in the ears of fools: because they will despise the instruction of thy speech.
sentences.chinese: 不要與愚人交耳接談，因他必輕視你的高見。

sentences.english: Those looking for the Big Idea from Mr Cameron will be disappointed.
sentences.chinese: 那些希望從卡梅倫身上找到高見的人可能要失望了。

sentences.english: 'What do you say, Watson ?' asked Sir Henry, turning to me.
sentences.chinese: “華生，您有何高見？”亨利爵士轉身向我問道。

sentences.english: What do you see as the trends in customer service for 2010?
sentences.chinese: 對於2010年的客服趨勢，歡迎分享您的高見。

sentences.english: So, what do you recommend to encourage affection?
sentences.chinese: 依你高見，怎麼才能促進感情？

sentences.english: What suggestions do you have for Da Silva to maintain his popularity if he wants to stay in office?
sentences.chinese: 如果盧拉想留任，你對他保持民意的方法有何高見？

sentences.english: Your opinons on house-decorating are sound.
sentences.chinese: 你對屋內的裝飾很有高見。

sentences.english: Do you have good suggestions for interior design?
sentences.chinese: 你對室內設計有何高見？

sentences.english: His advice on managing one's reputation online? Here is what he recommends
sentences.chinese: 他對管理個人在線聲譽有何高見？

sentences.english: Have you any hints on journal selection?
sentences.chinese: 關於期刊的選擇，您有何高見？

definition: Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
NASDAQ/National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations, a computerized data system to provide brokers with price quotations for securities traded over the counter
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to touch (physically, one's feelings etc)/to touch on (a topic)
Standard and Poor (share index)/abbr. for 標準普爾|标准普尔[Biao1 zhun3 Pu3 er3]
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
